authors: Maciąg-Dorszyńska M, Olszewski P, Karczewska M, Boss L
abstract: The stringent response is one of the fundamental mechanisms that control and modulate bacterial adaptation to stress conditions, such as nutrient limitation. The accumulation of stringent response effectors, (p)ppGpp, causes differential expression of approximately 500 genes, including genes of bacterial endogenous toxin-antitoxin (TA) systems. However, the exact link between (p)ppGpp and toxin-antitoxin systems' activation, as well as toxin-antitoxin role in stress adaptation remains disputed. In this study, we performed a complex analysis of changes (RNA-Seq) in the toxin-antitoxin operons' transcription in response to nitrogen, fatty acid, or carbon starvation, in bacteria with different abilities of (p)ppGpp accumulation.
